CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 14A, reads: "D.I. Models who made the annual benefit style show and dance a fascinating evening at Holiday House just outside of Pittsburgh, show the winning ways that turned hundreds of guests into delighted patrons..Alberta Thompson, one of Pittsburgh's most popular models...The nine hand-picked models showed the famous DuPont collection, which is created each year just for the National Foundation (March of Dimes). The D.I.'s headed by Gay DeHall, have as their sole project the National Foundation, and they plan to sponsor the Ebony Show in September. - Harris Photos"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alberta Thompson wearing double breasted suit, standing in Holiday House
CatSubject_tab: Clothing and dress--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Men--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Delightfully Insane Club Inc.Holiday House (Monroeville, Pa).Charities--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Fashion models--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.
